qas.question: What are early Greek philosophers known as?
What question were Greek philosophers trying to answer?

answers.text: How did the ordered cosmos in which we live come to be?

qas.question: Who was named "the father of science"?
Which religious deity did Thales undermine with his scientific theories?
Who was the first person to determine that the Earth is round?

context: The earliest Greek philosophers, known as the <a0_0>pre-Socratics<a0_0/>, provided competing answers to the question found in the myths of their neighbors: "<a1_0>How did the ordered cosmos in which we live come to be?<a1_0/>" The pre-Socratic philosopher <a2_0>Thales<a2_0/> (640-546 BC), dubbed the "father of science", was the first to postulate non-supernatural explanations for natural phenomena, for example, that land floats on water and that earthquakes are caused by the agitation of the water upon which the land floats, rather than the god <a3_0>Poseidon<a3_0/>. Thales' student Pythagoras of <a4_0>Samos<a4_0/> founded the Pythagorean school, which investigated mathematics for its own sake, and was the first to postulate that the Earth is spherical in shape. Leucippus (5th century BC) introduced atomism, the theory that all matter is made of indivisible, imperishable units called atoms. This was greatly expanded by his pupil Democritus.
